description.narrative:
The Within and Without the State-II project#s (WWS-II) overall objective in Afghanistan is to understand how Oxfam can best supportthe creation of an enabling environment where peace building efforts can be implemented by civil society and women#s rights organizations, and women are influential to effectively contribute to peace, reconciliation and conflict resolution processes. In its firsttwo phases, it has focussed on the empowerment of women and youth to have the knowledge, capacity and confidence to effectively engage with a range of local power holders at the provincial level and supporting the members of a national peacebulding network to effectively engage with formal and informal institutions and positively influence and support peace buildingefforts and Community PeacePromoters.
However, in the extension phase the aim of the project is to building on the knowledge and experience of WWS-II and other programmes in Afghanistan through conduction an action research on Natural Resource management. The proposed research in selectedgeographical locations during the five month extension will, as part of strengthening local capacities for peace and resilience: 1.Unpack the causal link between governance of natural resources (in terms of their access, actors, usage, management and capacity for dispute resolution) and gender equality, accountability, resilience and livelihoods, identify how these factors interact with eachother and act as drivers of conflict and fragility; 2. Identify entry points for the inclusion of women and youth in the governanceof natural resources to increased their access to more diverse and resilience livelihoods as well as contributing to a meaningful role in local peacebuilding processes; 3. Based on this understanding develop a Theory of Change, strategies and areas of intervention; towards, 4. Informing the development of a programme to strengthen local capacities for peace through an integrated area-based approach that enhances the collaborative capacities andnetworks of diverse stakeholders to manage different root causes of conflict.
The research is a two-fold process of (i) generating programme options by identifying causal links as stated above and (ii) using this as a vehicle to build the capacity of Oxfam staff and partners in conflict sensitive approaches to programme development and to harness reflective learning.
Oxfam with its partner organizations Afghanaid, TLO and PRB will conduct this Natural resource management action research (NRM-AR) inone district of each five targeted provinces that are Kabul, Balkh, Nangarhar, Daikundi and Herat within five months.

participating-org.narrative:
Partners in Revitalization and Building (formerly Pamir Reconstruction Bureau), PRB, a non -governmental organization was established in July 1990 by a group of Afghan experts headed by Eng. Mohammad Kabir. PRB since its inception supported sustainable economic and social recovery in its area of operation. Also PRB committed to peace building stability in Afghanistan by improving the basic living conditions for the people of rural and urban parts of the country.
The organization is committed in restoration of peace, security and good governance in Afghanistan. It supports and facilities the efforts of the people of Afghanistan to rebuild their country and attain and realize their basic human rights irrespective of religion, ethnicity, group , party affiliation, creed and gende

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands
